comments.text:
Any reason it can't be hidden using JS (when JS is enabled anyway) for the majority of countries that don't need it?

(INVALID isn't the right resolution here anyway. This is a BSD bug that *could* be fixed on their end one way or another. WONTFIX is fine if you really think it doesn't matter.)

comments.text: It's not BSD that requires it. It's PayPal. For fraud protection the address has to match the donor's billing address.
comments.author: cnovak@mozilla.com
comments.creator: cnovak@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text: It's not BSD that requires it. It's PayPal. For fraud protection the address has to match the donor's billing address.

Right – and forgive me for not knowing how "BSD" works here – but doesn't BSD need to require it on their end before passing it to PayPal or the transaction will fail? It'd make me sad if they didn't do any checking before sending PayPal an incomplete billing address. 

(But I guess I wouldn't be surprised in the least, given all these bugs piling up.)
